meanings.definition: A person who protects or keeps watch over someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The guard at the museum ensured no one touched the valuable artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The guard escorted the VIP safely through the crowded event.
meanings.sent3: The guard joked with the visitors while still keeping a close eye on the exhibits.
meanings.sent4: The guard of the castle stood tall like an unyielding fortress.
meanings.sent5: The guard's vigilant gaze never wavered, ensuring the safety of all within the premises.

meanings.definition: To protect or keep watch over someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She will guard the secret with her life, never revealing it to anyone.
meanings.sent2: The loyal dog guarded the house against any intruders.
meanings.sent3: He guarded the last piece of cake as if it were a precious treasure.
meanings.sent4: The old tree guarded the entrance to the hidden garden like a silent sentinel.
meanings.sent5: The knight vowed to guard the kingdom from all threats, no matter the cost.

meanings.definition: A device or part of a device designed to protect or cover a specific area.
meanings.sent1: The security guard scanned the area with the surveillance guard.
meanings.sent2: The phone case acted as a guard against scratches and damage.
meanings.sent3: The guard on the machine prevented any accidents from occurring.
meanings.sent4: The guard on the sword gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of protection.
meanings.sent5: The guard on the fence kept the children safe from wandering into the dangerous construction site.
